title: Exporting Bookmarks from Firefox on Mac and Windows

steps.title: Open Firefox.
steps.content: Open Firefox. The Firefox app icon resembles an orange fox wrapped around a blue and purple globe.

steps.title: Click ☰.
steps.content: Click ☰ . This three-line menu icon is in the top-right corner of the Firefox window. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Bookmarks.
steps.content: Click Bookmarks . It's usually the first item in the second grouping of menu options.

steps.title: Click Manage Bookmarks.
steps.content: Click Manage Bookmarks . It's at the bottom of the menu. You can also press Ctrl + Shift + O to open the Library.

steps.title: Click Import and Backup.
steps.content: Click Import and Backup . This option is next to two arrows pointing up and down at the top of the bookmarks library window. Clicking it prompts a drop-down menu. If you're using a Mac, you'll only see the up and down arrows instead of any text. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Export Bookmarks to HTML….
steps.content: Click Export Bookmarks to HTML… . You'll find it near the bottom of the drop-down menu. A File Explorer (Windows) or Finder (Mac) window will open.

steps.title: Enter a name for your bookmarks file.
steps.content: Enter a name for your bookmarks file. Type the name that you want to use for your bookmarks (e.g., "bookmarks 2022") into the "File name" or "Name" text box.

steps.title: Select a save location.
steps.content: Select a save location. Click a folder on the left side of the window (e.g., Desktop ). This is where your bookmarks file will be saved.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window. Doing so will save your bookmarks file under your chosen name in your selected save location.

steps.title: Close the Library window.
steps.content: Close the Library window. You can resume browsing Firefox at this point; closing the Library window won't delete your bookmarks or remove the exported Bookmarks file. [3] X Research source
